trans-unit.source: The user-level commands for using Imenu are described in the Emacs Manual (see Imenu in
The usual and simplest way is to set the variable imenu-generic-expression:
trans-unit.target: La forma habitual y más sencilla es establecer la variable imenu-generic-expression :

trans-unit.source: The usual conventions for displaying characters.
trans-unit.target: Las convenciones habituales para mostrar los personajes.

trans-unit.source: The usual effect of signaling an error is to terminate the command that is running and return immediately to the Emacs editor command loop. You can arrange to trap errors occurring in a part of your program by establishing an error handler, with the special form condition-case. A simple example looks like this:
trans-unit.target: El efecto habitual de señalar un error es terminar el comando que se está ejecutando y regresar inmediatamente al ciclo de comandos del editor de Emacs. Puede hacer arreglos para atrapar errores que ocurren en una parte de su programa estableciendo un manejador de errores, con la forma especial condition-case . Un ejemplo simple se ve así:

trans-unit.source: The usual interface functions for visiting.
trans-unit.target: La interfaz habitual funciona para las visitas.

trans-unit.source: The usual menu keymap item properties, :visible, :enable, :button, and :filter, are useful in tool bar bindings and have their normal meanings. The real-binding in the item must be a command, not a keymap; in other words, it does not work to define a tool bar icon as a prefix key.
trans-unit.target: Las propiedades usuales de elementos de menú, mapa de teclas :visible s , :enable , :button , y :filter , son útiles en los enlaces de la barra de herramientas y tienen sus significados normales. El real-binding en el elemento debe ser un comando, no un mapa de teclas; en otras palabras, no funciona definir un icono de barra de herramientas como clave de prefijo.

trans-unit.source: The usual purpose of tracking mouse motion is to indicate on the screen the consequences of pushing or releasing a button at the current position.
trans-unit.target: El propósito habitual del seguimiento del movimiento del ratón es indicar en la pantalla las consecuencias de pulsar o soltar un botón en la posición actual.

trans-unit.source: The usual read syntax for alphanumeric characters is a question mark followed by the character; thus, ‘
trans-unit.target: La sintaxis de lectura habitual para caracteres alfanuméricos es un signo de interrogación seguido del carácter; así, '

trans-unit.source: The usual reason to specify a documentation string for a type is to provide more information about the meanings of alternatives inside a choice type or the parts of some other composite type.
trans-unit.target: La razón habitual para especificar una cadena de documentación para un tipo es proporcionar más información sobre los significados de las alternativas dentro de un tipo de choice o las partes de algún otro tipo compuesto.

trans-unit.source: The usual regexp special characters are not special inside a character alternative. A completely different set of characters is special: ‘
trans-unit.target: Los caracteres especiales habituales de expresiones regulares no son especiales dentro de una alternativa de carácter. Un conjunto de caracteres completamente diferente es especial: '

trans-unit.source: The usual regular expression functions do backtracking when necessary to handle the ‘
trans-unit.target: Las funciones habituales de expresión regular hacen retroceso cuando es necesario para manejar el '

trans-unit.source: The usual role of a terminal-specific library is to enable special keys to send sequences that Emacs can recognize. It may also need to set or add to input-decode-map if the Termcap or Terminfo entry does not specify all the terminal’s function keys. See Terminal Input.
trans-unit.target: El papel habitual de una biblioteca específica de terminal es habilitar claves especiales para enviar secuencias que Emacs pueda reconocer. También puede ser necesario establecer o agregar a input-decode-map si la entrada de Termcap o Terminfo no especifica todas las teclas de función del terminal. Consulte Entrada de terminal .

trans-unit.source: The usual use of this feature is to fill comments in programming language modes. If the function needs to fill a paragraph in the usual way, it can do so as follows:
trans-unit.target: El uso habitual de esta característica es rellenar los comentarios en los modos de lenguaje de programación.Si la función necesita llenar un párrafo de la manera habitual,puede hacerlo de la siguiente manera:

trans-unit.source: The usual way to change the value of a variable is with the special form setq. When you need to compute the choice of variable at run time, use the function set.
trans-unit.target: La forma habitual de cambiar el valor de una variable es con la forma especial setq . Cuando necesite calcular la elección de la variable en tiempo de ejecución, utilice el set funciones .

trans-unit.source: The usual way to define a face is through the defface macro. This macro associates a face name (a symbol) with a default face spec. A face spec is a construct which specifies what attributes a face should have on any given terminal; for example, a face spec might specify one foreground color on high-color terminals, and a different foreground color on low-color terminals.
trans-unit.target: La forma habitual de definir una cara es a través de la macro defface . Esta macro asocia un nombre de cara (un símbolo) con una especificación de cara predeterminada . Una especificación de cara es una construcción que especifica qué atributos debe tener una cara en cualquier terminal dada; por ejemplo, una especificación de cara puede especificar un color de primer plano en terminales de color intenso y un color de primer plano diferente en terminales de color bajo.

trans-unit.source: The usual way to define the SMIE grammar of a language is by defining a new global variable that holds the precedence table by giving a set of BNF rules. For example, the grammar definition for a small Pascal-like language could look like:
trans-unit.target: La forma habitual de definir la gramática del SMIE de un idioma es definiendo una nueva variable global que mantiene la tabla de precedencia dando un conjunto de reglas BNF.Por ejemplo,la definición gramatical para un pequeño lenguaje tipo Pascal podría parecerse a:

trans-unit.source: The usual way to make a buffer-local binding is with make-local-variable, which is what major mode commands typically use. This affects just the current buffer; all other buffers (including those yet to be created) will continue to share the default value unless they are explicitly given their own buffer-local bindings.
trans-unit.target: La forma habitual de hacer un enlace local de búfer es con make-local-variable , que es lo que suelen utilizar los comandos del modo principal. Esto afecta solo al búfer actual; todos los demás búferes (incluidos los que aún no se han creado) seguirán compartiendo el valor predeterminado a menos que se les den explícitamente sus propios enlaces locales de búfer.

trans-unit.source: The usual way to make a menu keymap produce a menu is to make it the definition of a prefix key. (A Lisp program can explicitly pop up a menu and receive the user’s choice—see Pop-Up Menus.)
trans-unit.target: La forma habitual de hacer que un mapa de teclas de menú produzca un menú es convertirlo en la definición de una tecla de prefijo. (Un programa Lisp puede mostrar explícitamente un menú y recibir la elección del usuario; consulte Menús emergentes ).

trans-unit.source: The usual way to read a file into a buffer as a sequence of bytes, so you can decode the contents explicitly, is with insert-file-contents-literally (see Reading from Files); alternatively, specify a non-nilrawfile argument when visiting a file with find-file-noselect. These methods result in a unibyte buffer.
trans-unit.target: La forma habitual de leer un archivo en un búfer como una secuencia de bytes, para que pueda decodificar el contenido explícitamente, es con insert-file-contents-literally (consulte Lectura de archivos ); alternativamente, especifique un argumento de archivo sin rawfile no sea nil cuando visite un archivo con find-file-noselect . Estos métodos dan como resultado un búfer unibyte.

trans-unit.source: The usual way to reference a variable is to write the symbol which names it. See Symbol Forms.
trans-unit.target: La forma habitual de hacer referencia a una variable es escribir el símbolo que la nombra. Ver formas de símbolos .

trans-unit.source: The usual way to use the byte sequence that results from explicitly encoding text is to copy it to a file or process—for example, to write it with write-region (see Writing to Files), and suppress encoding by binding coding-system-for-write to no-conversion.
trans-unit.target: La forma habitual de utilizar la secuencia de bytes que resulta de la codificación explícita de texto es copiarla en un archivo o proceso, por ejemplo, escribirla con write-region (ver Escribir en archivos ) y suprimir la codificación vinculando coding-system-for-write a no-conversion .

trans-unit.source: The valid values of syntax-table text property are:
trans-unit.target: Los valores válidos de la propiedad de texto de la syntax-table de sintaxis son:

trans-unit.source: The value auto-raise should be used when your window manager has the focus automatically follow the position of the mouse pointer and a frame that gains focus is raised automatically.
trans-unit.target: El valor auto-raise debe usarse cuando su administrador de ventanas tiene el enfoque siguiendo automáticamente la posición del puntero del mouse y un marco que gana el enfoque se eleva automáticamente.

trans-unit.source: The value t should be used when your window manager has the focus automatically follow the position of the mouse pointer but a frame that gains focus is not raised automatically and may even remain occluded by other window-system windows.
trans-unit.target: El valor t debe usarse cuando su administrador de ventanas tiene el foco siguiendo automáticamente la posición del puntero del mouse, pero un marco que gana el foco no se eleva automáticamente y puede incluso permanecer ocluido por otras ventanas del sistema de ventanas.

trans-unit.source: The value <var>color</var> specifies the color to draw with. The default is the foreground color of the face for simple boxes, and the background color of the face for 3D boxes.
trans-unit.target: El valor de <var>color</var> especifica el color con el que dibujar. El valor predeterminado es el color de primer plano de la cara para cuadros simples y el color de fondo de la cara para cuadros 3D.

trans-unit.source: The value height is the value that was specified for the height of the horizontal scroll bar (which may be nil); lines is the (possibly rounded) number of lines that the horizontally scroll bar actually occupies.
trans-unit.target: La height del valor es el valor que se especificó para la altura de la barra de desplazamiento horizontal (que puede ser nil ); lines es el número (posiblemente redondeado) de líneas que ocupa realmente la barra de desplazamiento horizontal.

trans-unit.source: The value style specifies whether to draw a 3D box. If it is released-button, the box looks like a 3D button that is not being pressed. If it is pressed-button, the box looks like a 3D button that is being pressed. If it is nil or omitted, a plain 2D box is used.
trans-unit.target: El style valor especifica si se dibuja un cuadro 3D. Si se released-button , la caja se ve como un botón 3D que no se está presionando. Si se pressed-button , la caja se ve como un botón 3D que se está presionando. Si es nil o se omite, se utiliza un cuadro 2D simple.

trans-unit.source: The value width is the value that was specified for the width of the vertical scroll bar (which may be nil); columns is the (possibly rounded) number of columns that the vertical scroll bar actually occupies.
trans-unit.target: El width del valor es el valor que se especificó para el ancho de la barra de desplazamiento vertical (que puede ser nil ); columns es el número (posiblemente redondeado) de columnas que ocupa realmente la barra de desplazamiento vertical.

trans-unit.source: The value can also be a list of error conditions (see Signaling Errors). Then the debugger is called only for error conditions in this list (except those also listed in debug-ignored-errors). For example, if you set debug-on-error to the list (void-variable), the debugger is only called for errors about a variable that has no value.
trans-unit.target: El valor también puede ser una lista de condiciones de error (consulte Errores de señalización ). Luego, se llama al depurador solo para las condiciones de error en esta lista (excepto las que también se enumeran en debug-ignored-errors ). Por ejemplo, si establece debug-on-error en la lista (void-variable) , solo se llama al depurador para errores sobre una variable que no tiene valor.

trans-unit.source: The value can also be a symbol with a function definition. That is equivalent to t, except that the next warning will also call the function with no arguments with the warnings buffer current. The function can insert text which will serve as a header for the series of warnings.
trans-unit.target: El valor también puede ser un símbolo con una definición de función. Eso es equivalente a t , excepto que la siguiente advertencia también llamará a la función sin argumentos con el búfer de advertencias actual. La función puede insertar texto que servirá como encabezado para la serie de advertencias.

trans-unit.source: The value can also be floating point or a function, which specifies the height relative to an underlying face (see Displaying Faces). A floating-point value specifies the amount by which to scale the height of the underlying face. A function value is called with one argument, the height of the underlying face, and returns the height of the new face. If the function is passed an integer argument, it must return an integer.
trans-unit.target: El valor también puede ser un punto flotante o una función, que especifica la altura relativa a una cara subyacente (consulte Visualización de caras ). Un valor de punto flotante especifica la cantidad de escala de la altura de la cara subyacente. Se llama a un valor de función con un argumento, la altura de la cara subyacente, y devuelve la altura de la nueva cara. Si a la función se le pasa un argumento de número entero, debe devolver un número entero.

trans-unit.source: The value can be nil (don’t use parity), the symbol odd (use odd parity), or the symbol even (use even parity). If parity is not given, it defaults to no parity.
trans-unit.target: El valor puede ser nil (no use paridad), el símbolo odd (use paridad impar) o el símbolo even (use paridad par). Si no se da parity , el valor predeterminado es sin paridad.

trans-unit.source: The value can be a string; that should be the name of a file containing external-format X bitmap data. The file is found in the directories listed in the variable x-bitmap-file-path.
trans-unit.target: El valor puede ser una cadena; debe ser el nombre de un archivo que contenga datos de mapa de bits X en formato externo. El archivo se encuentra en los directorios enumerados en la variable x-bitmap-file-path .

trans-unit.source: The value can be an approximation. The function may avoid expensive processing and return an inexact result.
trans-unit.target: El valor puede ser una aproximación.La función puede evitar un procesamiento costoso y devolver un resultado inexacto.

trans-unit.source: The value cell holds a symbol’s value as a variable, which is what you get if the symbol itself is evaluated as a Lisp expression. See Variables, for details about how values are set and retrieved, including complications such as local bindings and scoping rules. Most symbols can have any Lisp object as a value, but certain special symbols have values that cannot be changed; these include nil and t, and any symbol whose name starts with ‘
trans-unit.target: La celda de valor contiene el valor de un símbolo como variable, que es lo que se obtiene si el símbolo en sí se evalúa como una expresión Lisp. Consulte Variables para obtener detalles sobre cómo se establecen y recuperan los valores, incluidas las complicaciones como los enlaces locales y las reglas de alcance . La mayoría de los símbolos pueden tener cualquier objeto Lisp como valor, pero ciertos símbolos especiales tienen valores que no se pueden cambiar; estos incluyen nil y t , y cualquier símbolo cuyo nombre comienza con '

trans-unit.source: The value decides which Lisp object to use for representing a JSON array. It can be either array, the default, to use Lisp arrays; or list to use lists.
trans-unit.target: El valor decide qué objeto Lisp usar para representar una matriz JSON. Puede ser una array , la predeterminada, para usar matrices Lisp; o list a para usar listas.

trans-unit.source: The value decides which Lisp object to use for representing the key-value mappings of a JSON object. It can be either hash-table, the default, to make hashtables with strings as keys; alist to use alists with symbols as keys; or plist to use plists with keyword symbols as keys.
trans-unit.target: El valor decide qué objeto Lisp usar para representar las asignaciones clave-valor de un objeto JSON. Puede ser una hash-table , la predeterminada, para hacer tablas hash con cadenas como claves; alist para usar una lista con símbolos como claves; o plist para usar plists con símbolos de palabras clave como claves.

trans-unit.source: The value decides which Lisp object to use to represent the JSON keyword false. It defaults to the symbol :false.
trans-unit.target: El valor decide qué objeto Lisp usar para representar la palabra clave JSON false . Por defecto, el símbolo es :false .

trans-unit.source: The value decides which Lisp object to use to represent the JSON keyword null. It defaults to the symbol :null.
trans-unit.target: El valor decide qué objeto Lisp usar para representar la palabra clave JSON null . Su valor predeterminado es el símbolo :null .

trans-unit.source: The value denotes the side of the frame or window where a new window displaying the buffer shall be created. This entry is used by display-buffer-in-side-window to indicate the side of the frame where a new side window shall be placed (see Displaying Buffers in Side Windows). It is also used by display-buffer-in-atom-window to indicate the side of an existing window where the new window shall be located (see Atomic Windows).
trans-unit.target: El valor denota el lado del marco o ventana donde se creará una nueva ventana que muestre el búfer. Esta entrada es utilizada por display-buffer-in-side-window para indicar el lado del marco donde se colocará una nueva ventana lateral (ver Visualización de búferes en ventanas laterales ). También lo usa display-buffer-in-atom-window para indicar el lado de una ventana existente donde se ubicará la nueva ventana (ver Atomic Windows ).

trans-unit.source: The value has no effect when renaming would not alter the owner or group of the file; that is, for files which are owned by the user and whose group matches the default for a new file created there by the user.
trans-unit.target: El valor no tiene efecto cuando el cambio de nombre no altera el propietario o el grupo del archivo,es decir,para los archivos que son propiedad del usuario y cuyo grupo coincide con el valor por defecto de un nuevo archivo creado allí por el usuario.

trans-unit.source: The value has the form (offset abbr). Here offset is an integer giving the number of seconds ahead of Universal Time (east of Greenwich). A negative value means west of Greenwich. The second element, abbr, is a string giving an abbreviation for the time zone, e.g., ‘
trans-unit.target: El valor tiene la forma (offset abbr) . Aquí, el offset es un número entero que indica el número de segundos por delante de la hora universal (al este de Greenwich). Un valor negativo significa al oeste de Greenwich. El segundo elemento, abbr , es una cadena que proporciona una abreviatura de la zona horaria, por ejemplo, '

trans-unit.source: The value is 5 because that is the
trans-unit.target: El valor es 5 porque ese es el

trans-unit.source: The value is nil for a subexpression inside a ‘
trans-unit.target: El valor es nil para una subexpresión dentro de un '

trans-unit.source: The value is nil if count is out of range, or for a subexpression inside a ‘
trans-unit.target: El valor es nil si el count está fuera de rango o para una subexpresión dentro de un '

trans-unit.source: The value is nil if pos is not visible in window. If window is nil, that stands for the selected window. If pos is nil, that stands for the value of point in window.
trans-unit.target: El valor es nil si pos no es visible en la window . Si la window es nil , significa la ventana seleccionada. Si pos es nil , significa el valor del punto en la window .

trans-unit.source: The value is nil if state represents a parse which has arrived at a top level position.
trans-unit.target: El valor es nil si el state representa un análisis que ha llegado a una posición de nivel superior.

trans-unit.source: The value is nil if the properties remain unchanged all the way to the end of object and limit is nil. If the value is non-nil, it is a position greater than or equal to pos. The value equals pos only when limit equals pos.
trans-unit.target: El valor es nil si las propiedades permanecen sin cambios hasta el final del object y el limit es nil . Si el valor no es nil , es una posición mayor o igual a pos . El valor es igual a pos solo cuando el limit es igual a pos .

trans-unit.source: The value is nil if the property remains unchanged all the way to the end of object and limit is nil. If the value is non-nil, it is a position greater than or equal to pos; it equals pos only if limit equals pos.
trans-unit.target: El valor es nil si la propiedad permanece sin cambios hasta el final del object y el limit es nil . Si el valor no es nil , es una posición mayor o igual a pos ; es igual a pos sólo si el limit es igual a pos .

trans-unit.source: The value is a form (an expression).
trans-unit.target: El valor es una forma (una expresión).

trans-unit.source: The value is a function.
trans-unit.target: El valor es una función.

trans-unit.source: The value is a key sequence. The customization buffer shows the key sequence using the same syntax as the
trans-unit.target: El valor es una secuencia clave.La memoria intermedia de personalización muestra la secuencia de teclas utilizando la misma sintaxis que la

trans-unit.source: The value is a list of all defined character set names.
trans-unit.target: El valor es una lista de todos los nombres de conjuntos de caracteres definidos.

trans-unit.source: The value is a list of forms (expressions).
trans-unit.target: El valor es una lista de formas (expresiones).

trans-unit.source: The value is a list of functions.
trans-unit.target: El valor es una lista de funciones.

trans-unit.source: The value is a predicate—a function of one argument that returns non-nil for success and nil for failure.
trans-unit.target: El valor es un predicado, una función de un argumento que devuelve un valor no nil para el éxito y nil para el fracaso.

trans-unit.source: The value is a program name.
trans-unit.target: El valor es un nombre de programa.

trans-unit.source: The value is a whole shell command.
trans-unit.target: El valor es un comando de shell completo.

trans-unit.source: The value is always a string ending with a slash.
trans-unit.target: El valor es siempre una cadena que termina con una barra.

trans-unit.source: The value is an alist or nested alist in which each element describes one unpacked field.
trans-unit.target: El valor es una lista o lista anidada en la que cada elemento describe un campo desempacado.

trans-unit.source: The value is an expression for determining whether the named menu item should be enabled in menus. See Simple Menu Items.
trans-unit.target: El valor es una expresión para determinar si el elemento de menú nombrado debe habilitarse en los menús. Consulte Elementos de menú simples .

trans-unit.source: The value is an interactive form for the named function. Normally, you should not set this directly; use the interactive special form instead. See Interactive Call.
trans-unit.target: El valor es una forma interactiva para la función nombrada. Normalmente, no debería configurar esto directamente; utilice el formulario especial interactive su lugar. Consulte Llamada interactiva .

trans-unit.source: The value is boolean—either nil or t. Note that by using choice and const together (see the next section), you can specify that the value must be nil or t, but also specify the text to describe each value in a way that fits the specific meaning of the alternative.
trans-unit.target: El valor es booleano: nil o t . Tenga en cuenta que mediante el uso de choice y const juntos (ver la siguiente sección), se puede especificar que el valor debe ser nil o t , sino también especificar el texto para describir cada valor de una manera que se ajuste al significado específico de la alternativa.

trans-unit.source: The value is copied from this-command when a command returns to the command loop, except when the command has specified a prefix argument for the following command.
trans-unit.target: El valor se copia de this-command cuando un comando regresa al bucle de comandos, excepto cuando el comando ha especificado un argumento de prefijo para el siguiente comando.

trans-unit.source: The value is either a major mode or a list of major modes. display-buffer-reuse-mode-window may reuse a window whenever the value specified by this entry matches the major mode of that window’s buffer. Other action functions ignore such entries.
trans-unit.target: El valor es un modo principal o una lista de modos principales. display-buffer-reuse-mode-window puede reutilizar una ventana siempre que el valor especificado por esta entrada coincida con el modo principal del búfer de esa ventana. Otras funciones de acción ignoran tales entradas.

trans-unit.source: The value is either the empty vector, or is a newly constructed nonempty vector that is not eq to any existing vector.
trans-unit.target: El valor es el vector vacío o es un vector no vacío recién construido que no es eq uivalente a ningún vector existente.

trans-unit.source: The value is measured in baud.
trans-unit.target: El valor se mide en baudios.

trans-unit.source: The value is negative if the first substring is less, positive if the first is greater, and zero if they are equal. The absolute value of the result is one plus the index of the first differing characters within the substrings.
trans-unit.target: El valor es negativo si la primera subcadena es menor,positivo si la primera es mayor,y cero si son iguales.El valor absoluto del resultado es uno más el índice de los primeros caracteres diferentes dentro de las subcadenas.

trans-unit.source: The value is normally nil; Lisp programs bind it to t for brief periods of time.
trans-unit.target: El valor es normalmente nil ; Los programas Lisp lo enlazan t durante breves períodos de tiempo.

trans-unit.source: The value is normally a list of the form (filenum devnum). This pair of numbers uniquely identifies the file among all files accessible on the system. See the function file-attributes, in File Attributes, for more information about them.
trans-unit.target: El valor es normalmente una lista del formulario (filenum devnum) . Este par de números identifica de forma única el archivo entre todos los archivos accesibles en el sistema. Consulte la función file-attributes de archivo , en Atributos de archivo , para obtener más información sobre ellos.

trans-unit.source: The value is normally an absolute file name. It can also be nil, if the definition is not associated with any file. If symbol specifies an autoloaded function, the value can be a relative file name without extension.
trans-unit.target: El valor es normalmente un nombre de archivo absoluto. También puede ser nil si la definición no está asociada a ningún archivo. Si el symbol especifica una función de carga automática, el valor puede ser un nombre de archivo relativo sin extensión.

trans-unit.source: The value is significant only as to whether it is nil or not. Since such variables often end up acquiring more values over time, this convention is not strongly recommended.
trans-unit.target: El valor es significativo solo en cuanto a si es nil o no. Dado que estas variables a menudo terminan adquiriendo más valores con el tiempo, no se recomienda encarecidamente esta convención.

trans-unit.source: The value may also be nil. Then all commands work normally, even disabled ones.
trans-unit.target: El valor también puede ser nil . Entonces, todos los comandos funcionan normalmente, incluso los desactivados.

trans-unit.source: The value may be any Lisp object that can be printed and read back. You can use sexp as a fall-back for any option, if you don’t want to take the time to work out a more specific type to use.
trans-unit.target: El valor puede ser cualquier objeto Lisp que pueda imprimirse y leerse. Puede usar sexp como alternativa para cualquier opción, si no quiere tomarse el tiempo para encontrar un tipo más específico para usar.

trans-unit.source: The value must be <var>value</var>—nothing else is allowed.
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser <var>value</var> ; no se permite nada más.

trans-unit.source: The value must be a character code. A character code is actually an integer, but this type shows the value by inserting the character in the buffer, rather than by showing the number.
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser un código de caracteres.Un código de carácter es en realidad un número entero,pero este tipo muestra el valor insertando el carácter en la memoria intermedia,en lugar de mostrar el número.

trans-unit.source: The value must be a coding-system name, and you can do completion with
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser un nombre de sistema de codificación,y se puede completar con

trans-unit.source: The value must be a cons cell, its CAR must fit car-type, and its CDR must fit cdr-type. For example, (cons string symbol) is a customization type which matches values such as ("foo" . foo).
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser una celda de contras, su CAR debe ajustarse car-type y su CDR debe ajustarse cdr-type . Por ejemplo, (cons string symbol) es un tipo de personalización que coincide con valores como ("foo" . foo) .

trans-unit.source: The value must be a directory. The widget provides completion.
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser un directorio.El widget proporciona la finalización.

trans-unit.source: The value must be a file name for an existing file. The widget provides completion.
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser un nombre de archivo para un archivo existente.El widget proporciona la terminación.

trans-unit.source: The value must be a file name. The widget provides completion.
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser un nombre de archivo.El widget proporciona la terminación.

trans-unit.source: The value must be a function taking one argument (a frame), supposed to return non-nil if that frame is a candidate for displaying the buffer. This entry is used by display-buffer-use-some-frame.
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser una función que tome un argumento (un marco), que se supone debe devolver un valor no nil si ese marco es candidato para mostrar el búfer. Esta entrada es utilizada por display-buffer-use-some-frame .

trans-unit.source: The value must be a function that takes one argument, a window, and returns either a new window (which will be used to display the desired buffer) or nil (which means the splitting failed). The default value is split-window-sensibly, which is documented next.
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser una función que tome un argumento, una ventana, y devuelva una nueva ventana (que se usará para mostrar el búfer deseado) o nil (lo que significa que la división falló). El valor predeterminado es split-window-sensibly , que se documenta a continuación.

trans-unit.source: The value must be a list and each element of the list must fit the type <var>element-type</var>. This appears in the customization buffer as a list of elements, with ‘
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser una lista y cada elemento de la lista debe ajustarse al tipo tipo de <var>element-type</var> . Esto aparece en el búfer de personalización como una lista de elementos, con '

trans-unit.source: The value must be a list of cons-cells, the <small>CAR</small> of each cell representing a key of customization type <var>key-type</var>, and the <small>CDR</small> of the same cell representing a value of customization type <var>value-type</var>. The user can add and delete key/value pairs, and edit both the key and the value of each pair.
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser una lista de contras-celdas, el <small>CAR</small> de cada celda que representa una clave de tipo de personalización <var>key-type</var> , y el <small>CDR</small> de la misma celda que representa un valor de tipo de personalización <var>value-type</var> . El usuario puede agregar y eliminar pares clave / valor y editar tanto la clave como el valor de cada par.

trans-unit.source: The value must be a list of functions. This customization type is used for hook variables. You can use the :options keyword in a hook variable’s defcustom to specify a list of functions recommended for use in the hook; See Variable Definitions.
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser una lista de funciones. Este tipo de personalización se utiliza para variables de gancho. Puede usar la palabra clave :options en el defcustom de una variable de gancho para especificar una lista de funciones recomendadas para usar en el gancho; Consulte Definiciones de variables .

trans-unit.source: The value must be a list with exactly as many elements as the <var>element-types</var> given; and each element must fit the corresponding <var>element-type</var>.
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser una lista con exactamente tantos elementos como los <var>element-types</var> dados; y cada elemento debe ajustarse al <var>element-type</var> correspondiente .

trans-unit.source: The value must be a list, and each element of the list must match one of the <var>types</var> specified.
trans-unit.target: El valor debe ser una lista y cada elemento de la lista debe coincidir con uno de los <var>types</var> especificados.

trans-unit.source: The value must be a number (floating point or integer).
The value must be a string. The customization buffer shows the string without delimiting ‘
The value must be a symbol which is a face name. The widget provides completion.
The value must be a symbol. It appears in the customization buffer as the symbol name. The widget provides completion.
The value must be a valid color name. The widget provides completion for color names, as well as a sample and a button for selecting a color name from a list of color names shown in a
The value must be a variable name. The widget provides completion.
The value must be an integer.
The value must be either a lambda expression or a function name. The widget provides completion for function names.
The value must be floating point.
The value must fit one of alternative-types. For example, (choice integer string) allows either an integer or a string.

The value must specify a window that may have displayed the buffer previously. display-buffer-in-previous-window will give preference to such a window provided it is still live and not dedicated to another buffer.
The value of (acos arg) is a number between 0 and pi (inclusive) whose cosine is arg. If arg is out of range (outside [-1, 1]), acos returns a NaN.
The value of (asin arg) is a number between -pi/2 and pi/2 (inclusive) whose sine is arg. If arg is out of range (outside [-1, 1]), asin returns a NaN.

The value of (atan y) is a number between -pi/2 and pi/2 (exclusive) whose tangent is y. If the optional second argument x is given, the value of (atan y x) is the angle in radians between the vector [x, y] and the X axis.
The value of auto-fill-function is do-auto-fill when Auto Fill mode is enabled. That is a function whose sole purpose is to implement the usual strategy for breaking a line.
The value of exec-path is used by call-process and start-process when the program argument is not an absolute file name.
The value of global-mode-string.

The value of input-decode-map is usually set up automatically according to the terminal’s Terminfo or Termcap entry, but sometimes those need help from terminal-specific Lisp files. Emacs comes with terminal-specific files for many common terminals; their main purpose is to make entries in input-decode-map beyond those that can be deduced from Termcap and Terminfo. See Terminal-Specific.

The value of kill-ring-yank-pointer is always eq to one of the links in the kill ring list. The element it identifies is the CAR of that link. Kill commands, which change the kill ring, also set this variable to the value of kill-ring. The effect is to rotate the ring so that the newly killed text is at the front.
The value of load-history may have one element whose CAR is nil. This element describes definitions made with eval-buffer on a buffer that is not visiting a file.
The value of mode-name.
The value of pointm at the last redisplay time.

The value of process-connection-type takes effect when make-process or start-process is called. So you can specify how to communicate with one subprocess by binding the variable around the call to these functions.

The value of track-mouse is that of the last form in body. You should design body to return when it sees the up-event that indicates the release of the button, or whatever kind of event means it is time to stop tracking.

The value of geometry should be a list of the form (width height x y). width and height specify the width and height of the cropped image. If x is a positive number it specifies the offset of the cropped area from the left of the original image, and if negative the offset from the right. If y is a positive number it specifies the offset from the top of the original image, and if negative from the bottom. If x or y are nil or unspecified the crop area will be centered on the original image.

The value of list specifies the objects to ask questions about. It should be either a list of objects or a generator function. If it is a function, it should expect no arguments, and should return either the next object to ask about, or nil, meaning to stop asking questions.

The value of package needs to be unique and it needs to match the package value appearing in the :package-version keyword. Since the user might see the value in an error message, a good choice is the official name of the package, such as MH-E or Gnus.
The value of persistent is the value specified for window with the last successful invocation of set-window-scroll-bars, nil if there never was one.
The value of a while form is always nil.

The value of a hook variable should be a list of functions. You can manipulate that list using the normal Lisp facilities, but the modular way is to use the functions add-hook and remove-hook, defined below. They take care to handle some unusual situations and avoid problems.
The value of point in each displayed buffer is saved and restored if edebug-save-displayed-buffer-points is non-nil.

The value of point is a number no less than 1, and no greater than the buffer size plus 1. If narrowing is in effect (see Narrowing), then point is constrained to fall within the accessible portion of the buffer (possibly at one end of it).

The value of such an element denotes the side of the existing window where the new window shall be located. Valid values are below, right, above and left. The default is below. The window-atom parameter of the new window is set to this value.

The value of such an element specifies an existing window the new window shall be combined with. If it specifies an internal window, all children of that window become part of the atomic window too. If no window is specified, the new window becomes a sibling of the selected window. The window-atom parameter of the existing window is set to main provided that window is live and its window-atom parameter was not already set.
The value of the :mime-charset property is also defined as an alias for the coding system.

The value of the :width, :align-to, :height, and :ascent properties can be a special kind of expression that is evaluated during redisplay. The result of the evaluation is used as an absolute number of pixels.
The value of the setq form is the value of the last form.

The value of the <var>key-regexp</var> argument specifies what part of each record is the sort key. The <var>key-regexp</var> could match the whole record, or only a part. In the latter case, the rest of the record has no effect on the sorted order of records, but it is carried along when the record moves to its new position.

The value of the <var>record-regexp</var> argument specifies how to divide the buffer into sort records. At the end of each record, a search is done for this regular expression, and the text that matches it is taken as the next record. For example, the regular expression ‘

The value of the last form in <var>body</var> is returned, unless the argument <var>quit-function</var> is specified. In that case, it is called with two arguments: the window showing the buffer and the result of <var>body</var>. The final return value is then whatever <var>quit-function</var> returns.
The value of the last form in <var>body</var> is returned.
The value of the optional argument <var>require-match</var> determines how the user may exit the minibuffer:

The value of this abnormal hook should be a list of functions, which are used to compute a completion table (see Basic Completion) for completing the text at point. It can be used by major modes to provide mode-specific completion tables (see Major Mode Conventions).
The value of this buffer-local variable is the (mode-specific) abbreviation table of the current buffer. It can also be a list of such tables.
The value of this buffer-local variable is the default directory for the current buffer. It should be an absolute directory name; it may start with ‘

The value of this buffer-local variable is the length of the current buffer, when it was last read in, saved, or auto-saved. This is used to detect a substantial decrease in size, and turn off auto-saving in response.
The value of this buffer-local variable is the list of saved former marks of the current buffer, most recent first.

The value of this buffer-local variable is the spacing between tab stops used for displaying tab characters in Emacs buffers. The value is in units of columns, and the default is 8. Note that this feature is completely independent of the user-settable tab stops used by the command tab-to-tab-stop. See Indent Tabs.

The value of this buffer-local variable should be a function (of no arguments) to be called after self-inserting a character from the table auto-fill-chars, see below. It may be nil, in which case nothing special is done in that case.

The value of this obsolete variable should be a list of functions that accept a single string argument and return another string. The default filter-buffer-substring function passes the buffer substring to the first function in this list, and the return value of each function is passed to the next function. The return value of the last function is passed to filter-buffer-substring-functions.

The value of this option can be also a list of frame parameters. In that case, implied resizing is inhibited for the change of a parameter that appears in this list. Parameters currently handled by this option are font, font-backend, internal-border-width, menu-bar-lines and tool-bar-lines.

The value of this option is an alist mapping conditions to display actions. Each condition may be either a regular expression matching a buffer name or a function that takes two arguments: a buffer name and the action argument passed to display-buffer. If either the name of the buffer passed to display-buffer matches a regular expression in this alist, or the function specified by a condition returns non-nil, then display-buffer uses the corresponding display action to display the buffer.
The value of this option should be a display action. This option can be used to define a standard display action for calls to display-buffer.

The value of this parameter is a cons cell whose CAR and CDR, if non-nil, specify the minimum values (in columns) for the left and right margin of this window (see Display Margins. When present, Emacs will use these values instead of the actual margin widths for determining whether a window can be split or shrunk horizontally.

The value of this property, help, specifies a help-echo string to display while the mouse is on that item. This is displayed in the same way as help-echo text properties (see Help display). Note that this must be a constant string, unlike the help-echo property for text and overlays.
The value of this user option is a symbol that specifies the style Emacs should use for single quotes in the wording of help and messages. If the option’s value is curve, the style is
The value of this variable determines the major mode of the initial
The value of this variable indicates the time at which Emacs was built. It uses the style of current-time (see Time of Day), or is nil if the information is not available.
The value of this variable is t once the command line has been processed.

The value of this variable is a buffer position (an integer or a marker) for expand-abbrev to use as the start of the next abbrev to be expanded. The value can also be nil, which means to use the word before point instead. abbrev-start-location is set to nil each time expand-abbrev is called. This variable is also set by abbrev-prefix-mark.
The value of this variable is a char-table (see Char-Tables) that specifies, for each character, its Unicode General_Category property as a symbol.
The value of this variable is a char-table that specifies the width of each character in columns that it will occupy on the screen.

The value of this variable is a char-table that specifies, for each character, a symbol whose name is the script to which the character belongs, according to the Unicode Standard classification of the Unicode code space into script-specific blocks. This char-table has a single extra slot whose value is the list of all script symbols.

The value of this variable is a char-table that specifies, for each character, whether it is printable or not. That is, if evaluating (aref printable-chars char) results in t, the character is printable, and if it results in nil, it is not.
The value of this variable is a char-table which defines glyphless characters and how they are displayed. Each entry must be one of the following display methods:
The value of this variable is a full keymap used by Electric Command Future mode. The functions in this map allow you to edit commands you have not yet thought about executing.

The value of this variable is a function that expand-abbrev will call with no arguments to do the expansion. The function can do anything it wants before and after performing the expansion. It should return the abbrev symbol if expansion took place.

The value of this variable is a function that filter-buffer-substring will call to do the actual work. The function receives three arguments, the same as those of filter-buffer-substring, which it should treat as per the documentation of that function. It should return the filtered text (and optionally delete the source text).

The value of this variable is a function that can be used by indent-region as a short cut. It should take two arguments, the start and end of the region. You should design the function so that it will produce the same results as indenting the lines of the region one by one, but presumably faster.

The value of this variable is a list of ImageMagick image types which Emacs may attempt to render using ImageMagick. Each list element should be one of the symbols in the list returned by imagemagick-types, or an equivalent string. Alternatively, a value of t enables ImageMagick for all possible image types. Regardless of the value of this variable, imagemagick-types-inhibit (see below) takes precedence.
The value of this variable is a list of all minor mode commands.

The value of this variable is a list of completion style (symbols) to use for performing completion. A completion style is a set of rules for generating completions. Each symbol occurring this list must have a corresponding entry in completion-styles-alist.

The value of this variable is a list of directories to search for programs to run in subprocesses. Each element is either the name of a directory (i.e., a string), or nil, which stands for the default directory (which is the value of default-directory). See executable-find, for the details of this search.

The value of this variable is a list of directories to search when loading files with load. Each element is a string (which must be a directory) or nil (which stands for the current working directory).

The value of this variable is a list of elements of the form (mode . abbrev-table) where mode is the name of a variable: if the variable is bound to a non-nil value, then the abbrev-table is active, otherwise it is ignored. abbrev-table can also be a list of abbrev tables.
The value of this variable is a list of event types that serve as alternative help characters. These events are handled just like the event specified by help-char.

The value of this variable is a list of functions to be called after a file is visited. The file’s local-variables specification (if any) will have been processed before the hooks are run. The buffer visiting the file is current when the hook functions are run.

The value of this variable is a list of functions to be called before writing out a buffer to its visited file. If one of them returns non-nil, the file is considered already written and the rest of the functions are not called, nor is the usual code for writing the file executed.

The value of this variable is a list of functions to be called when find-file or find-file-noselect is passed a nonexistent file name. find-file-noselect calls these functions as soon as it detects a nonexistent file. It calls them in the order of the list, until one of them returns non-nil. buffer-file-name is already set up.

The value of this variable is a list of symbols that are the features loaded in the current Emacs session. Each symbol was put in this list with a call to provide. The order of the elements in the features list is not significant.

The value of this variable is a list of the keywords to highlight. Lisp programs should not set this variable directly. Normally, the value is automatically set by Font Lock mode, using the keywords element in font-lock-defaults. The value can also be altered using the functions font-lock-add-keywords and font-lock-remove-keywords (see Customizing Keywords).

The value of this variable is a list of the values returned by all the expressions that were read, evaluated, and printed from buffers (including the minibuffer) by the standard Emacs commands which do this. (Note that this does not include evaluation in

The value of this variable is a list of themes loaded into Emacs. Each theme is represented by a Lisp symbol (the theme name). The default value of this variable is a list containing two dummy themes: (user changed). The changed theme stores settings made before any Custom themes are applied (e.g., variables set outside of Customize). The user theme stores settings the user has customized and saved. Any additional themes declared with the deftheme macro are added to the front of this list.
The value of this variable is a list of warnings to be displayed after the current command has finished. Each element must be a list
The value of this variable is a local keymap for characters following the Help key,
The value of this variable is a mode line construct that controls the contents of the mode-line. It is always buffer-local in all buffers.

The value of this variable is a nonnegative integer that controls whether Emacs signals a range error when a large integer would be calculated. Integers with absolute values less than 2**<var>n</var>, where <var>n</var> is this variable’s value, do not signal a range error. Attempts to create larger integers typically signal a range error, although there might be no signal if a larger integer can be created cheaply. Setting this variable to a large number can be costly if a computation creates huge integers.

The value of this variable is a string, the name of a directory that contains programs that come with GNU Emacs and are intended for Emacs to invoke. The program movemail is an example of such a program; Rmail uses it to fetch new mail from an inbox.
The value of this variable is a symbol indicating the type of operating system Emacs is running on. The possible values are:
The value of this variable is a symbol that specifies the style Emacs should use for single quotes in the wording of help and messages. If the variable’s value is curve, the style is
The value of this variable is an alist of package archives recognized by the Emacs package manager.
The value of this variable is an alist that associates the names of loaded library files with the names of the functions and variables they defined, as well as the features they provided or required.

The value of this variable is an alist whose elements have the form (face . remapping). This causes Emacs to display any text having the face face with remapping, rather than the ordinary definition of face.
The value of this variable is not guaranteed to be accurate except while processing frame-title-format or icon-title-format.

The value of this variable is the buffer for which abbrev-start-location has been set. Trying to expand an abbrev in any other buffer clears abbrev-start-location. This variable is set by abbrev-prefix-mark.

The value of this variable is the completion table (see Basic Completion) used for completion in the minibuffer. This is the global variable that contains what completing-read passes to try-completion. It is used by minibuffer completion commands such as minibuffer-complete-word.
The value of this variable is the default output stream—the stream that print functions use when the stream argument is nil. The default is t, meaning display in the echo area.

The value of this variable is the function called to insert an entry at point, including its terminating newline. The function should accept two arguments, id and contents, having the same meanings as in tabulated-list-entries. The default value is a function which inserts an entry in a straightforward way; a mode which uses Tabulated List mode in a more complex way can specify another function.

The value of this variable is the function to call to invoke the debugger. Its value must be a function of any number of arguments, or, more typically, the name of a function. This function should invoke some kind of debugger. The default value of the variable is debug.

The value of this variable is the function to use to revert this buffer. It should be a function with two optional arguments to do the work of reverting. The two optional arguments, ignore-auto and noconfirm, are the arguments that revert-buffer received.
The value of this variable is the greatest “small” integer that Emacs Lisp can handle. Typical values are 2**29 - 1 on 32-bit and 2**61 - 1 on 64-bit platforms.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el mayor entero "pequeño" que puede manejar Emacs Lisp. Los valores típicos son 2 ** 29 - 1 en 32 bits y 2 ** 61 - 1 en plataformas de 64 bits.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the help character—the character that Emacs recognizes as meaning Help. By default, its value is 8, which stands for
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el carácter de ayuda, el carácter que Emacs reconoce que significa Ayuda. Por defecto, su valor es 8, que significa

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the list of command-line arguments passed to Emacs.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es la lista de argumentos de la línea de comandos pasados a Emacs.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the list of command-line arguments that have not yet been processed.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es la lista de argumentos de la línea de comandos que aún no han sido procesados.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the list of properties to remove from inserted text. Its default value contains properties that might lead to annoying results, such as causing the text to respond to the mouse or specifying key bindings. It takes effect after yank-handled-properties.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es la lista de propiedades que se eliminarán del texto insertado. Su valor predeterminado contiene propiedades que pueden generar resultados molestos, como hacer que el texto responda al mouse o especificar combinaciones de teclas. Entra en vigor después yank-handled-properties .

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the maximum depth of nesting of parentheses and brackets when printed. Any list or vector at a depth exceeding this limit is abbreviated with an ellipsis. A value of nil (which is the default) means no limit.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es la profundidad máxima de anidación de paréntesis y corchetes cuando se imprime. Cualquier lista o vector a una profundidad que exceda este límite se abrevia con puntos suspensivos. Un valor de nil (que es el predeterminado) significa que no hay límite.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the maximum length to which the kill ring can grow, before elements are thrown away at the end. The default value for kill-ring-max is 60.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es la longitud máxima a la que puede crecer el kill ring, antes de que los elementos se desechen al final. El valor predeterminado de kill-ring-max es 60.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the maximum number of elements to print in any list, vector or bool-vector. If an object being printed has more than this many elements, it is abbreviated with an ellipsis.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el número máximo de elementos a imprimir en cualquier lista,vector o bool-vector.Si un objeto que se imprime tiene más que este número de elementos,se abrevia con una elipsis.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the maximum size of mark-ring. If more marks than this are pushed onto the mark-ring, push-mark discards an old mark when it adds a new one.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el tamaño máximo del mark-ring de marca . Si hay más marcas que éste se inserta en la mark-ring , push-mark descartes un viejo blanco cuando se añade una nueva.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the number of bytes of pure storage allocated so far. Typically, in a dumped Emacs, this number is very close to the total amount of pure storage available—if it were not, we would preallocate less.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el número de bytes de almacenamiento puro asignados hasta el momento. Por lo general, en un Emacs volcado, este número está muy cerca de la cantidad total de almacenamiento puro disponible; si no fuera así, preasignaríamos menos.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the number of bytes of storage that must be allocated for Lisp objects after one garbage collection in order to trigger another garbage collection. You can use the result returned by garbage-collect to get an information about size of the particular object type; space allocated to the contents of buffers does not count.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el número de bytes de almacenamiento que deben asignarse para los objetos Lisp después de una recolección de basura para activar otra recolección de basura. Puede utilizar el resultado devuelto por garbage-collect para obtener información sobre el tamaño del tipo de objeto en particular; el espacio asignado al contenido de los búferes no cuenta.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the number of lines of continuity to retain when scrolling by full screens. For example, scroll-up with an argument of nil scrolls so that this many lines at the bottom of the window appear instead at the top. The default value is 2.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el número de líneas de continuidad que se deben retener al desplazarse por pantallas completas. Por ejemplo, scroll-up con un argumento de desplazamiento nil para que esta cantidad de líneas en la parte inferior de la ventana aparezcan en la parte superior. El valor predeterminado es 2 .

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the number of newest versions to keep when a new numbered backup is made. The newly made backup is included in the count. The default value is 2.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el número de versiones más recientes para mantener cuando se hace una nueva copia de seguridad numerada.La copia de seguridad recién hecha se incluye en el recuento.El valor por defecto es 2.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the number of oldest versions to keep when a new numbered backup is made. The default value is 2.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el número de versiones más antiguas que hay que guardar cuando se hace una nueva copia de seguridad numerada.El valor por defecto es 2.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the number of seconds of idle time that should cause auto-saving. Each time the user pauses for this long, Emacs does auto-saving for all buffers in which that is enabled. (If the current buffer is large, the specified timeout is multiplied by a factor that increases as the size increases; for a million-byte buffer, the factor is almost 4.)
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el número de segundos de tiempo de inactividad que debería causar el auto-ahorro.Cada vez que el usuario hace una pausa de este tiempo,Emacs hace un auto-ahorro para todos los buffers en los que está activado.(Si el búfer actual es grande,el tiempo de inactividad especificado se multiplica por un factor que aumenta a medida que aumenta el tamaño;para un búfer de un millón de bytes,el factor es casi 4).

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the numerically least “small” integer that Emacs Lisp can handle. It is negative. Typical values are -2**29 on 32-bit and -2**61 on 64-bit platforms.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el número entero "pequeño" numéricamente mínimo que puede manejar Emacs Lisp. Es negativo. Los valores típicos son -2 ** 29 en 32 bits y -2 ** 61 en plataformas de 64 bits.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the raw prefix argument for the next editing command. Commands such as universal-argument that specify prefix arguments for the following command work by setting this variable.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es el argumento de prefijo sin formato para el siguiente comando de edición. Los comandos como universal-argument que especifican argumentos de prefijo para el siguiente comando funcionan estableciendo esta variable.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the standard display table, which is used when Emacs is displaying a buffer in a window with neither a window display table nor a buffer display table defined, or when Emacs is outputting text to the standard output or error streams. Although its default is typically nil, in an interactive session if the terminal cannot display curved quotes, its default maps curved quotes to ASCII approximations. See Text Quoting Style.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es la tabla de visualización estándar, que se usa cuando Emacs muestra un búfer en una ventana sin una tabla de visualización de ventana ni una tabla de visualización de búfer definida, o cuando Emacs está enviando texto a la salida estándar o flujos de error. Aunque su valor predeterminado es normalmente nil , en una sesión interactiva si el terminal no puede mostrar comillas curvas, su valor predeterminado asigna comillas curvas a aproximaciones ASCII. Consulte Estilo de cita de texto .

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is the version of Emacs being run. It is a string such as "26.1". A value with three numeric components, such as "26.0.91", indicates an unreleased test version. (Prior to Emacs 26.1, the string includes an extra final component with the integer that is now stored in emacs-build-number; e.g., "25.1.1".)
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable es la versión de Emacs que se está ejecutando. Es una cadena como "26.1" . Un valor con tres componentes numéricos, como "26.0.91" , indica una versión de prueba inédita. (Antes de Emacs 26.1, la cadena incluye un componente final adicional con el entero que ahora está almacenado en emacs-build-number ; por ejemplo, "25.1.1" .)

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable lists the ImageMagick image types which should never be rendered using ImageMagick, regardless of the value of imagemagick-enabled-types. A value of t disables ImageMagick entirely.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable enumera los tipos de imágenes de ImageMagick que nunca deben renderizarse usando ImageMagick, independientemente del valor de imagemagick-enabled-types . Un valor de t desactiva ImageMagick por completo.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable must be a function, which is called by completing-read to actually do its work. It should accept the same arguments as completing-read. This can be bound to a different function to completely override the normal behavior of completing-read.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable debe ser una función, que se llama completing-read para que realmente haga su trabajo. Debe aceptar los mismos argumentos que completing-read . Esto se puede vincular a una función diferente para anular completamente el comportamiento normal de completing-read .

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable names an Emacs Lisp file where the autoload calls should go. The default value is
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable nombra un archivo Emacs Lisp donde deben ir las llamadas de carga automática.El valor por defecto es

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable should be a display action, which is treated with the highest priority by display-buffer. The default value is an empty display action, i.e., (nil . nil).
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable debe ser una acción de visualización, que es tratada con la máxima prioridad por display-buffer . El valor predeterminado es una acción de visualización vacía, es decir, (nil . nil) .

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable should be a function (of no arguments) to be called whenever a character with close parenthesis syntax is inserted. The value of blink-paren-function may be nil, in which case nothing is done.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable debe ser una función (sin argumentos) que se llamará siempre que se inserte un carácter con sintaxis entre paréntesis. El valor de blink-paren-function puede ser nil , en cuyo caso no se hace nada.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable should be a function of two arguments: a process and the list of windows displaying the process’s buffer. When the function is called, the process’s buffer is the current buffer. The function should return a cons cell (width . height) that describes the dimensions of the logical process window to be passed via a call to set-process-window-size. The function can also return nil, in which case Emacs will not call set-process-window-size for this process.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable debe ser una función de dos argumentos: un proceso y la lista de ventanas que muestran el búfer del proceso. Cuando se llama a la función, el búfer del proceso es el búfer actual. La función debe devolver una celda cons (width . height) que describe las dimensiones de la ventana del proceso lógico que se pasará mediante una llamada a set-process-window-size . La función también puede devolver nil , en cuyo caso Emacs no llamará a set-process-window-size para este proceso.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable should be a function. When the user invokes a disabled command interactively, this function is called instead of the disabled command. It can use this-command-keys to determine what the user typed to run the command, and thus find the command itself.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable debe ser una función. Cuando el usuario invoca un comando desactivado de forma interactiva, se llama a esta función en lugar del comando desactivado. Puede usar this-command-keys para determinar qué escribió el usuario para ejecutar el comando y, por lo tanto, encontrar el comando en sí.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable should be a string whose syntax is a Lisp comment.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable debería ser una cadena cuya sintaxis sea un comentario de Lisp.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable should be either nil or a fraction f between 0 and 1. If it is a fraction, that specifies where on the screen to put point when scrolling down. More precisely, when a window scrolls down because point is above the window start, the new start position is chosen to put point f part of the window height from the top. The larger f, the more aggressive the scrolling.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable debe ser nil o una fracción f entre 0 y 1. Si es una fracción, eso especifica en qué parte de la pantalla colocar el punto al desplazarse hacia abajo. Más precisamente, cuando una ventana se desplaza hacia abajo porque el punto está por encima del inicio de la ventana, se elige la nueva posición de inicio para poner el punto f parte de la altura de la ventana desde la parte superior. Cuanto mayor sea la f , más agresivo será el desplazamiento.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable specifies a function to call to check whether a buffer needs reverting. The default value only handles buffers that are visiting files, by checking their modification time. Buffers that are not visiting files require a custom function of one optional argument noconfirm. The function should return non-nil if the buffer should be reverted. The buffer is current when this function is called.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable especifica una función a llamar para verificar si un búfer necesita revertirse. El valor predeterminado solo maneja búferes que visitan archivos, al verificar su hora de modificación. Los búferes que no visitan archivos requieren una función personalizada de un argumento opcional noconfirm . La función debe devolver un valor no nil si el búfer debe revertirse. El búfer es actual cuando se llama a esta función.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable specifies how often to do auto-saving, in terms of number of input events. Each time this many additional input events are read, Emacs does auto-saving for all buffers in which that is enabled. Setting this to zero disables autosaving based on the number of characters typed.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable especifica con qué frecuencia hacer el auto-guardado,en términos de número de eventos de entrada.Cada vez que se leen tantos eventos de entrada adicionales,Emacs hace el autoguardado para todos los buffers en los que está habilitado.Poner esto a cero desactiva el autoguardado basado en el número de caracteres tecleados.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable specifies the amount of consing before a garbage collection occurs, as a fraction of the current heap size. This criterion and gc-cons-threshold apply in parallel, and garbage collection occurs only when both criteria are satisfied.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable especifica la cantidad de consumo antes de que se produzca una recolección de basura, como una fracción del tamaño del montón actual. Este criterio y gc-cons-threshold aplican en paralelo, y la recolección de basura se produce solo cuando se cumplen ambos criterios.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable specifies the current sort key for the Tabulated List buffer. If it is nil, no sorting is done. Otherwise, it should have the form (name . flip), where name is a string matching one of the column names in tabulated-list-format, and flip, if non-nil, means to invert the sort order.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable especifica la clave de clasificación actual para el búfer de lista tabulada. Si es nil , no se realiza ninguna clasificación. De lo contrario, debería tener la forma (name . flip) , donde name es una cadena que coincide con uno de los nombres de columna en el tabulated-list-format , y flip , si no es nil , significa invertir el orden de clasificación.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable specifies the function to use to insert the updated contents when reverting this buffer. The function receives two arguments: first the file name to use; second, t if the user has asked to read the auto-save file.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable especifica la función que se utilizará para insertar el contenido actualizado al revertir este búfer. La función recibe dos argumentos: primero el nombre del archivo a utilizar; segundo, t si el usuario ha solicitado leer el archivo de guardado automático.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable specifies the maximum length for all history lists that don’t specify their own maximum lengths. If the value is t, that means there is no maximum (don’t delete old elements). If a history list variable’s symbol has a non-nilhistory-length property, it overrides this variable for that particular history list.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable especifica la longitud máxima para todas las listas de historial que no especifican sus propias longitudes máximas. Si el valor es t , eso significa que no hay máximo (no elimine elementos antiguos). Si el símbolo de una variable de la lista de historial tiene una propiedad de history-length no nil , anula esta variable para esa lista de historial en particular.

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable, if non-nil, is the current glyph table. It takes effect only on character terminals; on graphical displays, all glyphs are displayed literally. The glyph table should be a vector whose gth element specifies how to display glyph code g, where g is the glyph code for a glyph whose face is unspecified. Each element should be one of the following:
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable, si no es nil , es la tabla de glifos actual. Solo tiene efecto en terminales de caracteres; en las pantallas gráficas, todos los glifos se muestran literalmente. La tabla de glifos debe ser un vector cuyo g - ésimo elemento especifique cómo mostrar el código de glifo g , donde g es el código de glifo de un glifo cuya cara no está especificada. Cada elemento debe ser uno de los siguientes:

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable, if non-nil, should be a function. This function is called, with no arguments, after write-region has completed.
trans-unit.target: El valor de esta variable, si no es nil , debe ser una función. Esta función se llama, sin argumentos, después write-region haya completado la región de escritura .

trans-unit.source: The value returned by call-process (unless you told it not to wait) indicates the reason for process termination. A number gives the exit status of the subprocess; 0 means success, and any other value means failure. If the process terminated with a signal, call-process returns a string describing the signal. If you told call-process not to wait, it returns nil.
trans-unit.target: El valor devuelto por call-process (a menos que le haya dicho que no espere) indica el motivo de la terminación del proceso. Un número indica el estado de salida del subproceso; 0 significa éxito y cualquier otro valor significa fracaso. Si el proceso terminó con una señal, call-process devuelve una cadena que describe la señal. Si le dijo a call-process que no espere, devuelve nil .

trans-unit.source: The value returned by garbage-collect describes the amount of memory used by Lisp data, broken down by data type. By contrast, the function memory-limit provides information on the total amount of memory Emacs is currently using.
trans-unit.target: El valor devuelto por garbage-collect describe la cantidad de memoria utilizada por los datos Lisp, desglosada por tipo de datos. Por el contrario, la función memory-limit proporciona información sobre la cantidad total de memoria que Emacs está usando actualmente.

trans-unit.source: The value returned by parse-partial-sexp (a Lisp primitive for indentation and nesting computation) when it parses up to the beginning of this line.
trans-unit.target: El valor devuelto por parse-partial-sexp (una primitiva Lisp para el cálculo de sangría y anidamiento) cuando analiza hasta el comienzo de esta línea.

trans-unit.source: The value returned by save-excursion is the result of the last form in body, or nil if no body forms were given.
trans-unit.target: El valor devuelto por save-excursion es el resultado de la última forma en el body , o nil si no se proporcionaron formas de cuerpo.

trans-unit.source: The value returned by save-restriction is that returned by the last form in body, or nil if no body forms were given.
trans-unit.target: El valor devuelto por save-restriction es el devuelto por el último formulario en el body , o nil si no se proporcionaron formularios del cuerpo.

trans-unit.source: The value returned by window-state-get can be used in the same session to make a clone of a window in another window. It can be also written to disk and read back in another session. In either case, use the following function to restore the state of the window.
trans-unit.target: El valor devuelto por window-state-get se puede usar en la misma sesión para hacer un clon de una ventana en otra ventana. También se puede escribir en el disco y volver a leer en otra sesión. En cualquier caso, utilice la siguiente función para restaurar el estado de la ventana.

trans-unit.source: The value returned by the function is a vector of the form [name filename pixel-size max-width ascent descent space-width average-width capability]. Here’s the description of each components of this vector:
trans-unit.target: El valor devuelto por la función es un vector de la forma [name filename pixel-size max-width ascent descent space-width average-width capability] . Aquí está la descripción de cada componente de este vector:

trans-unit.source: The value returned by the function is a vector of the form [opened-name full-name size height baseline-offset relative-compose default-ascent max-width ascent descent space-width average-width filename capability]. Here’s the description of each components of this vector:
